chartDetail.title: Chart Details
chartDetail.generatingDesc: We are calculating planetary positions and generating astrological interpretations.
chartDetail.birthChartDesc: Complete visualization of your birth sky

bigThree.sunTooltip: The Sun represents your core identity, life purpose and vitality. It is the nucleus of your conscious personality.
bigThree.moonTooltip: The Moon represents your emotions, instinctive needs and unconscious reactions. It reveals how you feel safe and comfortable.
bigThree.ascTooltip: The Ascendant is the sign that was rising on the eastern horizon at your birth. It represents your social mask and first impression.

chartDetail.planetPositionsTooltip: Exact planetary positions calculated with Swiss Ephemeris (precision < 1 arcsecond). Includes longitude, latitude, speed and retrograde state.
chartDetail.astroHousesTooltip: The 12 houses divide the sky into sectors representing life areas. System used: {{system}}. Each house has a cusp (beginning) and a planetary ruler.
chartDetail.planetaryAspectsTooltip: Aspects are geometric angles between planets that reveal how they interact. We detect major aspects (conjunction, opposition, trine, square, sextile) and minor (quincunx, semisextile, etc.) with configurable orbs.
chartDetail.arabicPartsTooltip: Arabic Parts (or Lots) are mathematically calculated points from planetary positions. They reveal specific life themes according to Hellenistic tradition.
chartDetail.arabicPartsDesc: Sensitive points from Hellenistic astrological tradition

arabicParts.whatAreDesc: Arabic Parts (also called 'Lots' in Hellenistic tradition) are mathematically calculated points from planetary and angular positions. They function as 'virtual planets', revealing specific life themes.
arabicParts.formulaDesc: Part = Ascendant + Planet1 - Planet2 (all in degrees 0-360). Formulas differ between day charts (â˜€ï¸ Sun above horizon) and night charts (ðŸŒ™ Sun below horizon).
arabicParts.importanceDesc: The house where a Part falls and the aspects it receives from natal planets are significant. The Lot of Fortune is especially important - medieval astrologers treated it with the same importance as the Ascendant.
arabicParts.originDesc: Developed in Hellenistic astrology (Greece/Rome, 100 BC - 600 AD) and expanded by medieval Arab astrologers (700-1400 AD). There are hundreds of cataloged Parts, but the 4 presented here are the most fundamental.
arabicParts.technicalNoteDesc: Your chart is {{sect}} ({{sectDesc}}), so the formulas used follow the sect rules of Hellenistic tradition.
arabicParts.notAvailable: Arabic Parts not available for this chart.
arabicParts.willBeCalculated: Parts will be automatically calculated for charts created or updated after this feature.
